sources.title: Island of Lost Souls (1932)
sources.description: Island of Lost Souls is a 1932 American science fiction horror film directed by Erle C.  Kenton. It  is based on H.  G.  Wells' 1896 novel The Island of Doctor Moreau and stars Charles Laughton, Richard Arlen, and Kathleen Burke. The film  follows Edward Parker, a shipwrecked sailor who is rescued and taken to a remote island owned by the mad scientist Dr. Moreau.  There, Parker discovers that Moreau is conducting horrific experiments to transform animals into human-like creatures, including Lota, a woman derived from a panther, leading to a series of chilling events as Parker confronts Moreau's twisted ambitions.

metadata.Plot: After his ship goes down, Edward Parker is rescued at sea. Parker gets into a fight with Captain Davies of the Apia and the Captain tosses him overboard while making a delivery to the tiny tropical island of Dr. Moreau. Parker discovers that Moreau has good reason to be so secretive on his lonely island. The doctor is a whip-cracking task master to a growing population of his own gruesome human/animal experiments. He does have one prize result, Lota the beautiful panther woman. Parker's fortunes for escape look up after his fiancée Ruth finds him with the help of fearless Captain Donohue. However, when Moreau's tribe of near-humans rises up to rebel, no one is safe...
metadata.Writer: Waldemar Young, Philip Wylie, H.G. Wells
metadata.Actors: Charles Laughton, Bela Lugosi, Richard Arlen
